subject: p14744884
Findings: Lung volumes are low. The heart is top-normal size given the lung volumes. There is crowding of the bronchovascular structures with probable mild pulmonary vascular congestion. Patchy opacities in lung bases may reflect atelectasis. There are no large pleural effusions or pneumothorax. Right brachiocephalic/subclavian stent is again demonstrated.
Impression: Low lung volumes which limits assessment of the lung bases. Patchy opacities at the lung bases likely reflect atelectasis. Mild pulmonary vascular congestion.
